body:
Did you try install `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` under python 3.8~3.11 before the build?

In my machine, I used the following script:
```
call "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\VC\Auxiliary\Build\vcvarsall.bat" amd64 -vcvars_ver=14.36.32532

build.bat --cmake_generator "Visual Studio 17 2022" --config Release --cmake_extra_defines "CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHITECTURES=61;70;75;80;86" --parallel --build_shared_lib --build_dir .\build\trt_2022 --use_cuda --cuda_version "12.1" --cuda_home "C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v12.1" --cudnn_home "C:\CuDNN\8.8.1.3_cuda12" --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home "E:\TensorRT-8.6.0.12.Windows10.x86_64.cuda-12.0\TensorRT-8.6.0.12" --skip_tests --cmake_extra_defines onnxruntime_BUILD_UNIT_TESTS=OFF
```

> Did you try install `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` under python 3.8~3.11 before the build?
> 
> In my machine, I used the following script:
> 
> ```
> call "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\VC\Auxiliary\Build\vcvarsall.bat" amd64 -vcvars_ver=14.36.32532
> 
> build.bat --cmake_generator "Visual Studio 17 2022" --config Release --cmake_extra_defines "CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHITECTURES=61;70;75;80;86" --parallel --build_shared_lib --build_dir .\build\trt_2022 --use_cuda --cuda_version "12.1" --cuda_home "C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v12.1" --cudnn_home "C:\CuDNN\8.8.1.3_cuda12" --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home "E:\TensorRT-8.6.0.12.Windows10.x86_64.cuda-12.0\TensorRT-8.6.0.12"
> ```

@tianleiwu Thank you for your reply! Unfortunately it still does not work on my end. 

I tried installing the same version of CUDA, CUDNN, TensorRT and Visual Studio as in your command, ran the "pip install -r requirements-dev.txt" with Python 3.11.4 and then ran the exact same command as in your reply (except for the paths that CUDA, CUDNN and TensorRT were installed). But I still got the same error "Patch_EXECUTABLE_NOTFOUND" when "Performing patch step for gsl-populate". If I do not include "--use_tensorrt" and build with CPU provider or "--use_dml", there is no such issue and the gsl-populate step was suscessful without performing patch.

How is your TensorRT installed? I downloaded TensorRT from the following link, unzip it and directly used the path including "bin" and "lib" as tensorrt_home. Is there any extra step I need to do for TensorRT? https://developer.nvidia.com/downloads/compute/machine-learning/tensorrt/secure/8.6.0/zip/TensorRT-8.6.0.12.Windows10.x86_64.cuda-12.0.zip

@wrd920, your job failed due to Patch_EXECUTABLE-NOTFOUND. It is likely because patch.exe is not found in path. In my machine, it can be found in "C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\patch.exe" or "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\anaconda3\Library\usr\bin\patch.exe"

You can install [AnaConda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/) which contains patch.exe. After installing AnaConda, create a python environment to build like the following (TensorRT is updated to 8.6.1 GA here, need disable building unit tests to avoid build error):
```
conda create -n py310 python=3.10
conda activate py310
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
pip install cmake

call "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\VC\Auxiliary\Build\vcvarsall.bat" amd64

build.bat --cmake_generator "Visual Studio 17 2022" --config Release --build_wheel --cmake_extra_defines "CMAKE_CUDA_ARCHITECTURES=61;70;75;80;86" --parallel --build_shared_lib --use_cuda --cuda_version "12.1" --cuda_home "C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v12.1" --cudnn_home "C:\CuDNN\8.9.2.26_cuda12" --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home "E:\TensorRT-8.6.1.6.Windows10.x86_64.cuda-12.0\TensorRT-8.6.1.6"  --skip_tests --cmake_extra_defines onnxruntime_BUILD_UNIT_TESTS=OFF
```

During building, you can see output like:
```
Building ONNX Runtime for Windows 10 and newer
Patch found: C:/Users/USERNAME/AppData/Local/anaconda3/Library/usr/bin/patch.exe
```

For TensorRT installation, you can follow https://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/tensorrt/install-guide/index.html#installing-zip. Unzip the cuDNN and TensorRT installation zip files downloaded from Nvidia are enough for building onnxruntime. To run TensorRT, you will need add them to PATH etc.

> @wrd920, your job failed due to Patch_EXECUTABLE-NOTFOUND. It is likely because patch.exe is not found in path. In my machine, it can be found in "C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\patch.exe" or "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\anaconda3\Library\usr\bin\patch.exe"
> 
> You can install [AnaConda](https://www.anaconda.com/download/) which contains patch.exe. After installing AnaConda, create a python environment to build like the following (TensorRT is updated to 8.6.1 GA here, need disable building unit tests to avoid build error):
> 
> ```
> conda create -n py310 python=3.10
> conda activate py310
> pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
> pip install cmake
> call "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\VC\Auxiliary\Build\vcvarsall.bat" amd64
> build.bat --cmake_generator "Visual Studio 17 2022" --config Release --parallel --build_shared_lib --use_cuda --cuda_version "12.1" --cuda_home "C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v12.1" --cudnn_home "C:\CuDNN\8.9.2.26_cuda12" --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home "E:\TensorRT-8.6.1.6.Windows10.x86_64.cuda-12.0\TensorRT-8.6.1.6"  --skip_tests --cmake_extra_defines onnxruntime_BUILD_UNIT_TESTS=OFF
> ```
> 
> During building, you can see output like:
> 
> ```
> Building ONNX Runtime for Windows 10 and newer
> Patch found: C:/Users/USERNAME/AppData/Local/anaconda3/Library/usr/bin/patch.exe
> ```
> 
> For TensorRT installation, you can follow https://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/tensorrt/install-guide/index.html#installing-zip. Unzip the cuDNN and TensorRT installation zip files downloaded from Nvidia are enough for building onnxruntime. To run TensorRT, you will need add them to PATH etc.

Reinstalling git and adding it to PATH solves the issue. A lot of thanks!
